revised_title: Lymphocyte Cooperation and its Role in the Immune Response
tldr: This article discusses the cooperation between lymphocytes in the immune response, specifically focusing on the role of macrophage inhibition factors (MIF) and antigen-specific MIF in antibody formation. The authors propose a mechanism that may participate in the cooperative effect, which involves the production of an antigen-specific macrophage cytophilic factor by thymus-derived cells. They also highlight the importance of clarifying the role of this mechanism in antibody formation.
